author: xtqqczze
body:
The list of supported platforms in [README.md](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/4c2d6dcfca29894c91bbac2008a374d6cc4c5a3a/README.md) may be outdated.

_Issue initially communicated in: 13dca6e9fe5c2618ae34a5e75d69356b77284642._

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We always update the list near next release.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: For example, it is claimed that Fedora 30 is supported, but PowerShell LTS (7.0) uses .NET 3.1, which [no longer supports this distribution](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/main/release-notes/3.1/3.1-supported-os.md).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
You can look https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/announcing-powershell-7-1/ where Fedora 30 was mentioned as supported OS for PowerShell 7.1. PowerShell release process and support lifecycles are under full control by MSFT team.
PowerShell Team
Announcing PowerShell 7.1
We’re proud to announce the release of PowerShell 7.1, the latest major update to PowerShell 7. This release includes a number of improvements and fixes that build on top of the PowerShell 7.0 release in March and the recent GA release of .NET 5.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
> You can look https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/announcing-powershell-7-1/ where Fedora 30 was mentioned as supported OS for PowerShell 7.1.
> 
> PowerShell release process and support lifecycles are under full control by MSFT team.

That blog post links to and is based on https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/PowerShell-Docs/blob/staging/reference/docs-conceptual/PowerShell-Support-Lifecycle.md which states:

> "When a platform version reaches end-of-life as defined by the platform owner, PowerShell Core will also cease to support that platform version."

Clearly there are platforms on that list that are end-of-life and should therefore be removed.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: I've opened dotnet/core#6431 to clarify .NET support for Fedora 32.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Official support for official MSFT distributives is a completely MSFT team internal process. They will update the documents during the next release.

title: Update supported platforms in README
